alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; Natrona County Lower Elevations; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Natrona, southwestern Johnson and southeastern Washakie Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 359 PM MDT, trained weather spotters reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 18 miles southwest of Big Trails to 11 miles east of Cottonwood Pass to Waltman. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. 55 MPH wind gusts were reported earlier at Shoshoni. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Powder River around 410 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Big Trails. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; Natrona County Lower Elevations; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southeast Johnson County
